title: Support Us
text:
A project of this size and scope is possible only with the involvement, engagement and support of many, many people.
Are you interested in larger questions about how we live, how we relate to each other, and therefore, how we educate ourselves and our children? Do you agree that we need to fundamentally rethink our approach to ourselves, our relationships with others, nature, food systems, health and the need to rebuild a more sustainable education ecosystem?
Are you willing to join hands with a group of committed, capable people woarking with these objectives?
You can become a Friend of Farmhill - this a group of people who believe the work we do at Farmhill is important and support us financially and otherwise. Many friends visit us periodically, participate in the events we conduct, and stay with us once in a while!
Here is how you can support us.

title: Support Us
text:
Support Financially
We are a registered educational trust, and your contributions will be Income Tax exempt under the section 80G.
The easiest way to contribute to Farm Hill is using the Pay Instantly using Razorpay.

    

You can also contribute by transfer directly to our bank account or by making an UPI transfer.


Pay with UPI

Please note UPI ID shows up as venugvgk@yesbank as that is the username for the trust account.


Transfer to Our Bank Account
Bank Account Details:
Account name: Farm Hill Education Trust Account number: 041588700000083 Account type : current account – trust Bank and Branch: Yes Bank, bannerghatta road, Bangalore IFSC: YESB0000415



Why should you support us?
We aim to be operationally self-sufficient through contributions of active members of the Farm Hill Community. However, this is not always possible due to a few reasons.

We are a small community and we have not yet reached the optimum size where we can fully meet the operations costs.
We believe that people interested in joining the community should be able to join irrespective of their ability to contribute financially, which means we often end up with a deficit budget.
Farm Hill Education Trust has committed to build Subodha Learning Community, located in Bangalore, to better reach underserved populations.
The community is still very young. We are still incurring capital expenses for infrastructure, which cannot be met except for contributions from the larger community of friends and supporters.

Most importantly, you get to be a part of a community working for a cause!

title: People
text:
Founder and Trustee

                
            

            Venu (GVGK Raju) and Chitra have always been interested in alternatives to mainstream 
education and living, and plunged into it in 2009, when their child was diagnosed with autism.

Initially, Venu worked with an edtech startup and chitra acquired ABA training and certifications,
so as to work with their child better. Sambhavam was formally started in 2016, as an early intervention
center working with families living with autism. 

As their child and other children around them grew up, they saw that the many schools around them
not being able to meet the needs of children - neurodiverse or otherwise. This, and exposure to some
of the alternative schools they admire, led them to dream of a neurodiverse, close to nature, learning
community. 

That dream started to realise when they were able to open Farm Hill Learning in 2019. After five years 
of Farm Hill, and witnessing the benefits of a community for both parents and children, in 2024, they took
the step of opening Subodha Learning Community, a homeschool support center, in Banglore 

They divide their time between Bangalore and Farm Hill Learning, Shoolagiri, where they live on a 
mango farm in a community of teachers, therapists, adults and children. 

            
        
    

    
        
            
        
        
            
                
                Trustee

                
            

            Kiran Dontam has about fifteen years of experience working in the software industry in various 
capacities with big names like Amazon as well as some interesting startups. His passion for holistic
education has led him to join farm hill education trust as a trustee. 

He has a bachelors degree in Computer Science from IIT Kharagpur. He lives near farm hill learning,
where his child and wife are active members of the community.

title: About
text:
Farm Hill Education Trust is committed to working in the areas of Education, Neurodiversity and Community.
We aspire to build communities of support that ensure right education for children, and be inclusive of neurodiverse people.
